news_header: Alphabet is increasing its AI infrastructure spending significantly, joining other tech giants like Microsoft and Meta, despite market concerns about their business trends.
news_original_title: Mag 7 Members Report Strong Earnings, Double Down on CapEx
news_text: Alphabet has announced a 47% increase in its spending on artificial intelligence infrastructure, with a capex budget of $75 billion. This aligns with similar aggressive spending plans from Microsoft and Meta. Despite a decline in Alphabet's shares post-announcement, the company reported a 28.3% increase in Q4 earnings year-over-year. The tech sector is expected to continue its growth trajectory into 2024, with double-digit earnings growth anticipated across various sectors, even without the contributions from the major tech players.
